alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 4:20PM MDT until June 22 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Montana... Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. For the Gallatin River...including Logan...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Gallatin River at Logan. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.1 feet, Water may cross some smaller roads. At 8.3 feet, Minor lowland flooding may occur near Logan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river level is forecast to fluctuate between 8.3 and 8.5 feet through Tuesday before slowly falling around mid week. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next update will be issued no later than Tuesday morning at 815 AM MDT.
